title: Technical Architecture Presentation

content.speaker: Presenter
content.text: Welcome everyone to the technical architecture review.

content.speaker: Presenter
content.text: Today we will cover system overview, data flow, and integration points.

content.speaker: Attendee
content.text: Can you elaborate on the database sharding strategy?

content.speaker: Presenter
content.text: Certainly. We plan to shard by region and by customer segment to optimize performance.

content.speaker: Attendee
content.text: How do we handle cross-shard transactions?

content.speaker: Presenter
content.text: We use an orchestrator service that manages distributed transactions with compensation patterns.

content.speaker: Presenter
content.text: Moving on to our microservices design, each service is containerized and communicates over gRPC.

content.speaker: Attendee
content.text: What's the expected latency between services?

content.speaker: Presenter
content.text: Under normal load it's under 5ms, with spike handling up to 20ms.

content.speaker: Attendee
content.text: Are we encrypting data at rest?

content.speaker: Presenter
content.text: Yes, using AES-256 on all storage volumes.

summary: Presented the architecture, database sharding, microservices design, security considerations, and answered questions regarding latency and transactions.
